channel.title: Home on Crab
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Crab

item.title: Welcome to my blog
item.description: This page is intended to give you a feeling of what a blog post looks like. Crab supports both fixed (static) pages as well as blog posts. In order to make blog pages work correctly, you need proper permalinks settings in your site’s config.toml. Hugo will then treat all files in the blog directory (for example) like blog posts. Have a look at the config.toml provided with this example site, as well as the page about Permalinks from the Hugo docs.

item.title: More
item.description: Here are a few more demo pages: Some more menu items to show the nested menus feature

item.title: Tags
item.description: Crab also supports tags. This page has some tags, as you can see below, although tags are probably more common with blog posts. If you click on a tag, you’ll be redirected to a page that shows all pages and posts with that tag. (For some tags, there is only this one page.)

item.title: Two-column layout
item.description: This is what sidebar content looks like. Actually, this page has more info on: alpha beta gamma Crab allows you to put content in a second column on the right-hand side of the page. You could use this space to provide the reader with a quick summary of what the current page is all about. On mobile devices, the summary is rendered directly above the actual page content.

item.title: Nested menus
item.description: Crab supports nested menus up to three levels deep. This is especially helpful for websites that focus on content with a fixed, pre-defined strucure.

item.title: Responsive design
item.description: Crab’s design is responsive, it adapts to smaller screens of mobile devices. Check out this example site on your smartphone or tablet (or on your desktop computer if you’re currently on mobile).

item.title: Contact
item.description: This is a an example contact page. item.title: More blogging
item.description: This is yet another blog post to demonstrate the blog feature. It’s from a different month than other posts, to show you how the archive feature works.

item.title: Features
item.description: Some of Crab’s features are: Responsive design Nested menus Two-column layout Click on the links above to learn more.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
